Job Title: Production Development Specialist

Location: Senatobia, MS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

As a Production Development Specialist, you will drive improvements in production of Electrification Smart Power (ELSP) in Senatobia, Mississippi.

You will be responsible to optimize the production organization’s processes, equipment and electrical testing methods to minimize labor hours in accordance with Lean 6Sigma methodology and business strategies related to quality, efficiency, costs and safety.

This position reports to

Process Engineering Manager ATS

Your responsibilities

Define the working phase sequence of a new production process to achieve the targeted product cost and equipment investment budget. Ensure appropriate production methods, cycle time, equipment performance and materials/components in support of production targets. Support Production with product and system testing. Prepare new test standards and completes test instruction documentationUtilize Lean 6Sigma methodologies to identify and recommend improvement opportunities and implements improvement projects, ensuring adherence to timeframe, quality and cost requirements Ensure the production process complies with the project targets. Approve the design for processes developed internally or externally and perform final tests with respect to the projectProvide support to Production during the internal/external process/equipment start up, defining action plans and training relevant maintenance and production resourcesEvaluate new process technologies to improve productivity, quality and cost reduction, defining and leading testing activities, approval criteria and external provider choices

Your background

Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Industrial Engineering is strongly preferred OR Associate degree PLUS 3 years of technical based experience, preferably in electrical control systems manufacturing or maintenanceKnowledge of Lean principlesKnowledge of Automatic Transfer Switches is a plusProgramming knowledge a plusCandidates must already have a work authorization that would permit them to work for ABB in the US


Benefits

Retirement planLife insuranceHealthcare planDisability insuranceWellbeing program

More about us

ABB Smart Power is a global technology leader, with products and solutions that make power supplies smart, connected and protected. Its intelligent products and solutions make power more competitive by improving the energy efficiency, productivity and reliability of almost any operation.

We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action at ABB

ABB is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizen status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status, family medical leave status, or protected veterans status. For more information regarding your (EEO) rights as an applicant, please visit the following websites:

https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf

https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/OFCCP/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf

As an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, applicants may request to review the Affirmative Action Plan of a particular ABB facility between the hours of 9:00 A.M. - 5:00 P.M. EST Monday through Friday by contacting an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762.

Protected veterans and qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access ABB's career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling an ABB HR Representative at 1-888-694-7762 or by sending an email to US-AskHR@abb.com. Resumes and applications will not be accepted in this manner.
